summary: Another take on ENB shaders.  Description within.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v228/Palderon/updatepic2.jpg[/img][/center]

[center][heading][size=10]2.0 - No More Glow![/size][/heading]
Glowing waterways have now been reduced in content 97.35%!  Nighttime water now gives off a nice moonlit reflection instead of toxic radiation****.  Several lightings redone to compensate for required changes.  Torch flicker very noticeable now, additionally firelight during a storm is noticeably weaker.
2.1 - Reattached some loose ends.
2.2 - Fixed some glaring problems (hoho!), I think I might finally be happy with it, at least until I find the next obvious thing I missed.

1.1 - More tweaking!  A little tweak here, a little tweak there, here a tweak there a tweak everywhere a tweak tweak.  Noticeable differences between clear nights and stormy nights.  Made more things look pretty.  Nerfed your eyesight to compensate***.  Highly recommend [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8562]More Rain[/url] and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8328]More Snow[/url].  Also possibly [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8741]Torches for Realistic Lighting[/url], havn\'t tried this one myself yet but I can\'t increase torchlight without making stupid random lights Bethesda put in become super bright.

1.0 - DoF!  Depth of Field now active, thanks to Matso.  [b]If you do NOT like it, included in each is a file named D-OFFenbseries.ini, delete the enbseries.ini and rename that in it\'s place to turn it off[/b].  Couple of night tweaks, increased power of the moon slightly.  Sailor Scouts have now been seen roaming the lands**.

0.9 - Clouds!  Put them all through the wash.  They are now fluffier and whiter during the day.  Overcast nights are now darker.  Skies are bluer.  Birds are singier*.  Attempted to better balance moonlight in various areas, apparently some areas don\'t like moonlight as much.  Decreased saturation slightly.  Made sunny days feel a bit more sunny.[/center]

[img=left]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v228/Palderon/2012-02-04_00002.jpg[/img]
[color=cyan]Daytime[/color]
The light should feel dry on a sunny day, but not detract from plants which still look healthy green, especially in the southern areas.  Shadows are darkened and noticeable, but not pitch black.  The sun isn\'t a ball of glare taking up the entire sky.

[color=cyan]Nighttime[/color]
Moonlight is WHITE, not blue.  There\'s still a small blue-shift but not a glowing blue hue encompassing everything.  Light is determined primarily by luminosity and reflection, if you\'re in a field under a full moon you\'re going to see just fine, but stand in the shadow of a mountain you better bring a torch.  Very little artificial brightness added.  Small amount of bloom used for moonlit glow.

[color=cyan]Indoors[/color]
Vivid lighting, dark shadows.  Tried to make caves feel dry and dusty, while ruins feel a bit more damp.

[color=cyan]Features[/color]
Reconfigured eye adaptation, shouldn\'t leave you blind for 2 seconds after taking fire to the face but still darken shadowed areas of your vision.  Nighttime dragon fights look amazing.

[color=cyan]Install[/color]
Extract all files into your Skyrim root directory, where the .exe is.  Do not extract into the data folder.
[b]Important[/b]: Be sure to set bFloatPointRenderTarget=1 and bFXAAEnabled=1 in SkyrimPrefs.ini for best results.

[color=cyan]Uninstall[/color]
Delete all files.  None overwrote Skyrim game files.  Or use [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7804]volvaga0\'s remover[/url].

Note: [s]Glowing water at night is a currently known ENB bug.[/s]  Except not anymore!


[center][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9066]Real Lights - Cities[/url] is highly recommended.

[color=cyan]Credits[/color]
Tapioks, if you don\'t like mine [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=822]go check out his[/url].
Boris Vorontsov, creator of [url=http://enbdev.com]ENBSeries[/url].
Matso for DoF code.[/center]

*I in no way guarantee your birds will be singier.
**I in no way guarantee sailor scouts are roaming your land.
***I in no way guarantee I nerfed your eyesight.
****Those of you who desire to be mutant ninja vikings will be pleased to know v1.1 will be kept around for your irradiated pleasure.
author: Palderon
